Title: The Passing of the Grey Company

AllCards.Title: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Setup: Each player may trade heroes without incurring a threat penalty. The first player may raise each player’s threat by 1 to search his deck for Anduril and add it to his hand. Remove each burden with these burden set icons from the encounter deck: A Shadow of the Past, Flight to the Ford, The Ring Goes South, The Passage of the Marshes, Shelob’s Lair
Front.FlavorText: `...there is only one way through the mountains that will bring me to the coastlands before all is lost. That is the Paths of the Dead.` -Aragorn, The Return of the King

Text: Resolution: Add each copy of Overcome by Fear attached to a player`s threat dial to the campaign pool and record the name of each player it was attached to. If Army of the Dead is in the victory display, add the Army of the Dead boon to the campaign pool. The players have earned each card added to the campaign pool
Back.FlavorText: Then Aragorn said: `The hour is come at last. Now I go to Pelargir upon Anduin, and ye shall come after me. And when all this land is clean of the servants of Sauron, I will hold the oath fulfilled, and ye shall have peace and depart for ever. For I am Elessar, Isildur`s heir of Gondor.` -The Return of the King

Text: Setup: The first player claims The One Ring and attaches it to the Ring-bearer.
Attached hero does not count against the hero limit. The first player gains control of attached hero.
If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Black Riders

Text: Response: Spend 1 Fellowship resource and exhaust The One Ring to cancel the effect of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck. Shuffle that card back into the encounter deck and reveal another encounter card.
Front.FlavorText: `I will take the Ring,` he said, `though I do not know the way.` -The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Response: After Frodo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust The One Ring and spend 1 Fellowship resource to target the attacking enemy. Then, this attack deals no damage and each player raises his threat by 2.
Front.FlavorText:
`But there is more about you now than appears on the surface.`
-Bilbo, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game.
Action: Spend 2 resources from Aragorn`s resource pool to ready a hero.
Action: Spend 1 Fellowship resource and exhaust The One Ring to give Frodo Baggins +2 Willpower and +2 Attack until the end of the round.
Front.FlavorText:
`It`s my doom, I think, to go to that Shadow yonder, so that a way will be found.`
-The Two Towers

Text: The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game.
While Aragorn has an Artifact attached, he gains sentinel and does not exhaust to quest.
Front.FlavorText:
`I have no help to send, therefore I must go myself...`
-The Return of the King

Text: Planning Action: Exhaust The One Ring to add 1 resource to a hero`s pool.
Front.FlavorText:
`I must carry the burden to the end.`
-The Return of the King

Text: The first player gains control of Aragorn.
Action: Spend 1 resource from Aragorn`s pool to ready him. (Limit once per phase.)
If Aragorn leaves play the players lose the game.
Front.FlavorText:
`As I have begun, so I will go on.`
-The Return of the King

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to the Ring-bearer.
Action: Add Mr. Underhill to the victory display to choose an enemy engaged with you. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot attack you.
Front.FlavorText:
`I will give you a travelling name now. When you go, go as Mr. Underhill.`
-Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: The first player gains control of Gildor Inglorion.
Forced: At the end of the round, discard Gildor Inglorion. The first player may spend 1 Fellowship resource to cancel this effect.
Front.FlavorText:
`We think you had best come now with us.`
-The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: A Shadow of the Past

Text: Setup: Add Gandalf`s Delay to the staging area.
Each player draws 1 less card in his starting hand.
Front.FlavorText:
The next day Frodo became really anxious, and kept a constant look-out for Gandalf. Thursday, his birthday morning, dawned as fair and clear as it had long ago for Bilbo`s great party. Still Gandalf did not appear.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: A Shadow of the Past

Text: Surge.
When Revealed: At the end of the phase, each enemy in the staging area engages the first player. If the One Ring is exhausted, this effect cannot be canceled.
Front.FlavorText: `Also,` he added, and his voice sank to a whisper, `the Ring draws them` -The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: A Shadow of the Past

Text: Surge.

When Revealed: Attach to the Ring-bearer. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: At the beginning of each quest phase, either exhaust The One Ring or reveal and additional encounter card this phase.`)
Front.FlavorText: Once more the desire to slip on the Ring came over Frodo... -The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Flight to the Ford

Text: Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must either exhaust the Ring-bearer or reveal and additional encounter card
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 3.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Flight to the Ford

Text: Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must deal X damage divided among heroes he controls where X is the number of players in the game.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to defending character.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Flight to the Ford

Text: Surge.
When Revealed: The first player raises his threat by 3 and passes the first player token to the next player.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Flight to the Ford

Text: Surge.
When Revealed: The first player must exhaust The One Ring. If The One Ring is already exhausted, the first player must discard 2 cards at random from his hand.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Defending player discards 1 card at random from his hand.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Flight to the Ford

Text: Setup: The first player attaches Old Bogey-stories to a hero in play.
Action: Add Old Bogey-stories to the victory display to shuffle your hand of at least 6 cards into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.
Front.FlavorText: `If you mean the old bogey-stories Fatty`s nurses used to tell him, about goblins and wolves and things of that sort, I should say no.` -Merry, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Setup: The first player adds this card to his hand.
Response: Add this card to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool to cancel the `when revealed` effects of an encounter card just revealed from the encounter deck.
Front.FlavorText:
By fire, sun and moon, harken now and hear us!
Come, Tom Bombadil, for our need is near us!
-Frodo, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 defense and gains the Ranger trait.
Front.FlavorText:
`What roads would any dare to tread, what safety would there be in quiet lands, or in the homes of simple men at night, if the Dúnedain were asleep, or were all gone into the grave?`
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +2 hit points and gains the Healer trait.
Front.FlavorText:
`Few now have the skill of healing to match such evil weapons. But I will do what I can.`
-Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower and gains the Noble trait.
Front.FlavorText:
Venerable he seemed as a king crowned with many winters, and yet hale as a tried warrior in the fullness of his strength.
-The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 Attack and gains the Warrior trait.
Front.FlavorText:
`Three of the servants of Sauron were upon the Bridge, but they withdrew and I pursued them westward.`
-Glorfindel, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense.
Response: After attached hero exhausts to defend an attack, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card`s Threat.
Attach to a Noble hero or Aragorn. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense.

Response: After an attack in which the attached hero defended resolves, exhaust Andúril to target the enemy that just attacked. Declare attached hero as an attacker against that enemy (and resolve the attack).
Attach to the Ring-bearer.
Attached hero gets +1 Defense and +1 hit point.
Front.FlavorText:
`I should feel happier if I knew you were wearing it. I have a fancy it would turn even the knives of the Black Riders...`
-Bilbo, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Add Phial of Galadriel to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to give each enemy engaged with you -4 Attack until the end of the round.
Front.FlavorText: `May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.` -Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Attach to a Warrior hero or Gandalf. Restricted.
Attached character gets +2 Attack.
Response: After attached character destroys an Orc enemy, draw 1 card.
Front.FlavorText: `...at his side was the elven-sword Glamdring, the mate of Orcrist that lay now upon the breast of Thorin under the Lonely Mountain.` -The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Leaf-wrapped Lembas to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool, to ready all heroes in play.
Front.FlavorText: Often in their hearts they thanked the lady of Lórien for the gift of lembas, for they could eat of it and find new strength even as they ran. -The Two Towers

Text: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Three Golden Hairs to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool, to lower each player`s threat by 3. Then, each player draws 3 cards.
Front.FlavorText: `...your hands shall flow with gold, and yet over you gold shall have no dominion.` -Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Setup: Attach to a hero in play.
Action: Add Lórien Rope to the victory display, and remove it from the campaign pool to give each location in the staging area -2 Threat until the end of the phase.
Front.FlavorText: `What a piece of luck you had that rope!` -Frodo, The Two Towers

Text: When Revealed: Attach to a non-Fellowship hero in play. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: After The One Ring exhausts, raise each player`s threat by 1 and reduce attached hero`s Willpower to 0 until the end of the round.`

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Ring Goes South

Text: When Revealed: Treat the printed text box of each character in play as blank (except for Traits) until the end of the round.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Defending character does not count its Defense.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Journey in the Dark

Text: When Revealed: Each enemy engaged with a player, and not in the staging area, makes an immediate attack.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Journey in the Dark

Text: Setup: Add Overcome by Grief to the staging area.

Forced: After a character is destroyed, if Overcome by Grief is unattached, attach to a hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: After a character you control is destroyed, exhaust attached hero. Until the end of the round, attached hero cannot ready.`)

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Journey in the Dark

Text: Setup: Add Grievous Wound to the staging area.

`Forced: After a hero takes damage, if Grievous Wound is unattached, attach to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: After attached hero exhausts, deal 1 damage to it.`)

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Journey in the Dark

Text: When Revealed: Put the topmost enemy of the encounter deck discard pile into play engaged with you.
Front.FlavorText: `Quite apart from murder by night on his own account, he may put any enemy that is about on our track.` -Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Breaking of the Fellowship

Text: When Revealed: Attach to a hero you control. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: `Forced: After a character you control is destroyed, raise your threat by 2.`)
Front.FlavorText: `Alas! An ill fate is on me this day, and all that I do goes amiss.` -Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Breaking of the Fellowship

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Healer hero.
Action: Exhaust attached hero and Hands of a Healer to heal up to 3 damage from a hero.
Front.FlavorText:
`Life to the dying
In the king`s hand lying!`
-Herb-master, The Return of the King

Text: Attach to Fellowship Aragorn.

Quest Action: Exhaust Aragorn and Palantír of Orthanc to discard the top card of the encounter deck. If Aragorn`s Willpower is greater than the discarded card`s Threat, you may add Palantír of Orthanc to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool to choose a player. That player reveals 1 fewer encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0).
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Ranger hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Forewarned to discard 1 shadow card from that enemy.
Front.FlavorText:
`Faint and far are the feet of our enemies.`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, +1 Defense and cannot have treachery card attachments.
Front.FlavorText:
`Beyond all hope you return to us in our need!`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Warrior hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as the only attacker against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Intimidation to give that enemy -2 Defense for this attack.
Front.FlavorText:
`None knows what the new day shall bring him,` said Aragorn. `Get you gone, ere it turn to your evil!`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Noble hero.
Response: After attached hero quests successfully, exhaust Leader of Men to add 1 resource to attached hero`s pool.
Front.FlavorText:
`Take this, dear lord!` said a clear voice. `It was ever at your service.`
-The Two Towers

Text: Poisoned Counsels functions like a player card.
Forced: After you draw this card, discard all other cards in your hand.
Front.FlavorText: `And ever Wormtongue`s whispering was in your ears, poisoning your thought, chilling your heart, weakening your limbs...` -Gandalf, The Two Towers

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Helm's Deep

Text: Play only if you control the Ring-bearer.
Planning Action: Add Brace of Coneys to the victory display to (choose 2): heal up to 2 damage from a hero, add 2 resources to a hero`s pool, draw 2 cards, or reduce a player`s threat by 2.
Front.FlavorText: ``Sméagol always helps,` he said. `He has brought rabbits, nice rabbits.`` —Gollum, The Two Towers

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to the Ring-bearer.
Forced: At the end of the planning phase, either raise each player`s threat by 1, or exhaust the Ring-bearer.
Front.FlavorText:
`It`s heavy on me, Sam lad, very heavy. I wonder how far I can carry it?`
—Frodo Baggins, The Two Towers

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: Shelob's Lair

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains the Rohan trait.
Attached hero gets +1 Attack while attacking with another Rohan character.
Front.FlavorText:
`Rise now, Meriadoc, esquire of Rohan of the household of Meduseld!`
-Théoden, The Return of the King

Text: Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains the Gondor trait.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower while commited to the quest with another Gondor character.
Front.FlavorText:
`Here do I swear fealty and service to Gondor, and to the Lord and Steward of the realm...`
-Pippin, The Return of the King

Text: Immune to player card effects. The first player gains control of Army of the Dead.
Setup: The first player takes control of Army of the Dead.
If Army of the Dead leaves play, remove it from the game.
Front.FlavorText:
`Now come! By the Black Stone I call you!`
-Aragorn, The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Setup: Attach to your threat dial. Limit 1 per threat dial.
Your threat cannot be reduced.
Forced: At the end of the round, raise your threat by 1. Then you may spend 1 Fellowship resource to detach Overcome by Fear and set it aside, out of play.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Immune to player card effects.

Forced: After The Stone of Erech becomes the active location, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Travel: Remove 5 progress from stage 3B to travel here.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: While Dark Door is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.
Travel: The first player reveals an encounter card to travel here.
Front.FlavorText:
...before him stood a stony door closed fast...
-The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: While Trysting Place is in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area cannot take damage.
Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: While Deadly Road is in the staging area, it gains: `Forced: After a `when revealed` effect is canceled, raise each player`s threat by 1.`
Travel: Spend 1 Fellowship resource to travel here.
Front.FlavorText:
`I was held to the road only by the will of Aragorn.`
-Gimli, The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Haunted Path gets +1 Threat for each player with a threat of 35 or higher.
Travel: Raise each player`s threat by 1 to travel here.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Either raise your your threat by 2, or return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Forced: After Dead Man of Dunharrow engages you, either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or raise your threat by 2.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Either raise each player`s threat by 2, or reveal an additional encounter card.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack and loses the Phantom keyword for this attack.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or Ghosts of Men makes an immediate attack against you.
Front.FlavorText: ...a rumour came after him like the shadow-sound of many feet. -The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Forced: When Shadow Host engages you, either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or it makes an immediate attack.
Front.FlavorText:
`In that gloom the Shadow Host seemed to grow stronger and more terrible to look upon.`
-Legolas, The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Each player with a threat of 35 or higher deal 1 damage to each exhausted character he controls.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: If your threat is 35 or higher, defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or progress cannot be placed on the current quest until the end of the round.
Front.FlavorText: `It was made by those who are Dead, and the Dead keep it...` -Old Man, The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or each character you control gets -1 Willpower, -1 Attack, and -1 Defense until the end of the round.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if undefended).

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or discard an ally you control
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Setup: Set The Stone of Erech and Army of the Dead aside, out of play. Each player attaches a copy of Overcome by Fear to his threat dial. Remove each unattached copy of Overcome by Fear from the game.
Front.FlavorText: `I must take new counsel for myself and my kindred. We must ride our own road, and no longer in secret. For me the time of stealth has passed. I will ride by the swiftest way, and I will take the Paths of the Dead.` -Aragorn, The Return of the King

Text: When Revealed: Each player may add 1 resource to the resource pool of each hero he controls. Each player who does so must raise his threat by 3.
Forced: At the end of the planning phase, discard all cards in each player’s hand and advance to stage 2A.
Back.FlavorText: `This is an evil door,` said Halbarad, `and my death lies beyond it. I will dare to pass nonetheless...` -The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Front.FlavorText: He could see nothing but the dim flame of the torches; but if the company halted, there seemed an endless whisper of voices all about him, a murmur of words in no tongue that he had ever heard before. -The Return of the King

Text: X is the threat of the player with the highest threat.
Each player cannot reduce his threat below his initial threat level.
Forced: At the beginning of the planning phase each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1, or you cannot play cards this phase.
Back.FlavorText: ...there could be no turning back; all the paths behind were thronged by an unseen host that followed in the dark. -The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: When Revealed: Add The Stone of Erech and Army of the Dead (enemy side faceup) to the staging area. Each player may raise his threat by 3 to detach Overcome by Fear from his threat dial and set it aside, out of play.
Front.FlavorText: `I see shapes of Men and of horses, and pale banners like shreds of cloud, and spears like winter-thickets on a misty night. The Dead are following.` -Legolas, The Return of the King

Text: While Stone of Erech is the active location, each Oathbreaker enemy loses the Phantom keyword and gets -20 engagement cost.
When The Stone of Erech leaves play as an explored location, the players win the game.
Back.FlavorText: `Yes, the Dead ride behind. They have been summoned.` -Elladan, The Return of the King

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company

Text: Immune to player card effects.
X is twice the number of players in the game.
Forced: When Army of the Dead attacks, you must either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or discard an ally you control.

EncounterInfo.EncounterSet: The Passing of the Grey Company
